text: [Music]
[Music]
hi i'm sharon a cloud support engineer
here at the aws office in dallas
today i'm going to show you how you can
resolve the error the request could not
be satisfied request blocked from
cloudfront this error can occur due to
aws warf rules associated with the
cloudfront distribution
let's get started
after logging in to the aws management
console
navigate to the amazon cloudfront
console page
select the cloudfront distribution id
and find the aws web acl id associated
with your distribution
navigate to the aws warf and aws shield
console page and choose web acls in the
left hand side menu
select the region as global cloudfront
now
check the aws of default action that is
set on the associated web access control
list by going to the rules tab
and checking under the heading
default web acl action for requests that
don't match any rules
if the default action is set to allow
then the request that returns the
request blocked error likely matches a
rule that has action set to block
to resolve the error review the requests
to be sure that they don't match the
conditions for any aws work rules with
action set to block
if valid requests match the conditions
for a rule that blocks requests then
update the rule to allow the requests
click edit
for action select allow
and then click on save rule
if the default action is set to block
then aws blocks requests either when the
request matches the conditions of a rule
that has action set to block
or if the request doesn't match the
conditions of any rule that has action
set to allow
to resolve this review the requests to
be sure that they match the conditions
for any aws rules with action set to
allow
if valid requests don't match any
existing rules that allow requests
create a rule that allows the requests
for the statement section
enter your inspect match type and the
string to match
to troubleshoot further
use the aws waff and aws shield console
to review a sample of requests that
match the rule that might be causing the
request blocked error
for each sampled request you can view
detailed data about the request such as
the originating ip address and the
headers included in the request you can
also view which rule the request matched
and whether the rule is configured to
allow or block requests
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
you
